intro: Lippia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping and drought-tolerant gardens. Its essential oils, derived from the leaves, are used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine. Lippia mexicana is also valued as a nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
